title: How to Fix a Water Pump in a Vehicle

steps.title: Confirm that the water pump is nonoperational by examining the functionality of the bearings by manually jostling the fan blade.
steps.content: Confirm that the water pump is nonoperational by examining the functionality of the bearings by manually jostling the fan blade. [1] X Research source This applies to fan operated cooling systems. The fan bearing should remain firmly seated if it is not in need of repair.

steps.title: Jiggle the pulley that operates the pump in the case of a motorized fan.
steps.content: Jiggle the pulley that operates the pump in the case of a motorized fan. The shaft should remain tight if it is working properly.

steps.title: Inspect the pump casing for splotches, caused by an inordinate amount of fluid leakage, which would indicate a faulty seal.
steps.content: Inspect the pump casing for splotches, caused by an inordinate amount of fluid leakage, which would indicate a faulty seal. A few drops of water should sweat from the vent hole over a long period of time, but a ruined seal will cause excessive overflow.

steps.title: Detach the negative battery line once the faulty water pump has been verified.
steps.content: Detach the negative battery line once the faulty water pump has been verified. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the radiator cap and empty the radiator by disengaging the valve under the front passenger's side.
steps.content: Remove the radiator cap and empty the radiator by disengaging the valve under the front passenger's side.

steps.title: Remove the fan belt, if one is present.
steps.content: Remove the fan belt, if one is present.

steps.title: Detach the radiator hoses.
steps.content: Detach the radiator hoses.

steps.title: Unbolt the fan shroud, found on the water pump's shaft.
steps.content: Unbolt the fan shroud, found on the water pump's shaft.

steps.title: Remove the fan shroud.
steps.content: Remove the fan shroud. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the bolts from the fan and dislodge it.
steps.content: Remove the bolts from the fan and dislodge it.

steps.title: Disengage the bolts from the drive pulley and remove it.
steps.content: Disengage the bolts from the drive pulley and remove it.

steps.title: Dislodge the bolts from the dysfunctional water pump and remove it.
steps.content: Dislodge the bolts from the dysfunctional water pump and remove it.

steps.title: Scrape any dirt and debris away from the area surrounding the gaskets.
steps.content: Scrape any dirt and debris away from the area surrounding the gaskets. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Apply industrial cleaning solution to the area and clean it thoroughly.
steps.content: Apply industrial cleaning solution to the area and clean it thoroughly.

steps.title: Follow the water pump manufacturer's instructions regarding sealant for the gaskets.
steps.content: Follow the water pump manufacturer's instructions regarding sealant for the gaskets.

steps.title: Apply gasket sealant, if directed.
steps.content: Apply gasket sealant, if directed. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Install the replacement gaskets.
steps.content: Install the replacement gaskets. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Position the replacement water pump and secure the bolts.
steps.content: Position the replacement water pump and secure the bolts. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Reinstall the drive pulley.
steps.content: Reinstall the drive pulley.

steps.title: Position the fan and the shroud and reinstall the bolts.
steps.content: Position the fan and the shroud and reinstall the bolts.

steps.title: Reattach the radiator hoses.
steps.content: Reattach the radiator hoses.

steps.title: Reinstall the fan belt, referring to the manufacturer's belt routing diagram.
steps.content: Reinstall the fan belt, referring to the manufacturer's belt routing diagram. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Confirm that the radiator valve is closed and refill the radiator.
steps.content: Confirm that the radiator valve is closed and refill the radiator.

steps.title: Seal the radiator cap.
steps.content: Seal the radiator cap.

steps.title: Reconnect the negative battery cable.
steps.content: Reconnect the negative battery cable.

steps.title: Start the car and verify that there are no irregular noises or leaks.
steps.content: Start the car and verify that there are no irregular noises or leaks.
